items.text: short, wide, he hammers a cut straight to backward point
items.shortText: Chatara to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: Muzarabani is struggling with his lines and lengths. This time he errs in line and sprays it wide outside off
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 wide

items.text: back of a length and outside off, punched up to mid-off
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: on a length and outside off, Shakib presses forward and stokes it to mid-off again
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: hip-high short ball on middle and leg, Shakib swivels on the back foot and sweetly pulls the ball to deep square leg
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: tip and run to cover-point. Tamim and Shakib keep Bangladesh ticking
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.preText: Golam Rahman Fa: "Shakib is perfect for no. 3."
items.text: Shakib rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and secures a single to third man
items.postText: Istiak Alif: "Anamul looked very agreesive right from the start of his inning! though it hasn't paid off but pretty happy to see him in this kind of approach. You know what, this is the first time he batted in an odi match with a strike rate of 100+. Better luck for him next time. " --- First time with a 100-plus strike-rate?
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: good length and runs through the corridor with extra bounce, left alone
items.postText: walrus: "Tamim seems to be the only batsman with a basic international level temperament in BD among openers. All tried and tested openers have failed due to their poor temperament and judgement. Anamul, on paper, looks like a perfect partner for Tamim, being right-handed clean opener with plenty of runs in the domestic competitions but he has always lacked the temperament required of international players. Come to think of it, that's the case for a LOT of BD players, past and present. Needs to be sorted"
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: on a length and outside off, tapped to backward point
items.shortText: Chatara to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: Shakib spoons a leading edge but it dies in front of backward point tearing in. Raza dives forward but the ball eludes his reach. It fell well short of him
items.shortText: Chatara to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: full and wide outside off, carted through the line to sweeper cover
items.shortText: Chatara to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.preText: Raqib: "@Moony It's been almost 12 years since Bangladesh is ranked higher than Zimbabwe, not to mention they are 3 steps ahead of them now. So i guess it's long enough!"
items.text: low full-toss outside off, Shakib stretches out and middles a cover-drive, places it between covers and mid-off
items.shortText: Chatara to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

items.text: nudged from off stump to the left of short midwicket
items.shortText: Chatara to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.preText: Jabed: "I would rather start planning who are our next Tamim, Mushi and Shakib now and gradually trial them.. seeing the under 19 team in NZ.. I would be keen to try out Saif, Hridoy, Afif and of course persist with Mosaddek.. and we also need to keep looking for young fast bowlers along with Taskin and co."
items.text: full and outside off, Tamim stretches out and drives to sweeper cover
items.shortText: Chatara to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: back of a length and turns back in on off stump, blocked to midwicket off the back foot
items.shortText: Cremer to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: tossed up on off, worked square through the leg side for one
items.postText: Kamrul: "@Irs : I was a long supporter of Kayes. Always thought only he among all Bangladeshi left handed batsmen has the right skill and temperament to be super consistent. Turned out he rarely learns from mistakes. An average of 29 from 70 matches is rather ordinary, on top of that he only scored 125 runs from 5 matches in 2017."
items.shortText: Cremer to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: full and sliding away of off, played back to the left of the bowler
items.shortText: Cremer to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: short and bounces on middle, late-cut wide of short third man off the back foot
items.shortText: Cremer to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: short and turns away - googly - outside off, jabbed to backward point. Tamim gesticulates it went the other way
items.shortText: Cremer to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: tickles it off the pads to short fine leg
items.shortText: Cremer to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: full and straight, tip and run to midwicket
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: pushed to midwicket again, this time off the inside half
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: shorter offbreak, turns away outside off, forced with great authority through the covers
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.text: tossed on middle, dabs it off the face to backward point and hares across to the other end
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: short, wide, belted straight to extra cover
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Shakib Al Hasan, no run
